modules.description: Extracts code blocks from Markdown and replaces them with HTML elements featuring syntax highlighting. Operates on Omd abstract syntax tree blocks, using a predefined list of supported programming languages. Enables seamless conversion of marked code sections into styled HTML output.

Highlights source code in a specified language and returns HTML-formatted strings. Operates on source code strings and programming language identifiers. Used to generate syntax-highlighted HTML for code snippets in web interfaces.

Parses markdown documents and converts code blocks into HTML with inline CSS classes for syntax highlighting. Works with strings representing markdown content and outputs styled HTML fragments. Processes OCaml code blocks, embedding them with semantic tags for accurate visual representation.

Transforms Markdown code blocks into syntax-highlighted HTML by analyzing Omd ASTs and applying language-specific formatting. Processes raw code strings with language identifiers to produce styled HTML outputs. Supports a predefined set of programming languages for consistent highlighting. Enables dynamic code rendering in web applications by converting both Markdown and standalone code snippets into visually distinct HTML elements.
